author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body:
Your `new package` pull request met all of the guidelines for auto-merging and is scheduled to be merged when the mandatory waiting period (3 days) has elapsed.

Since you are registering a new package, please make sure that you have read the package naming guidelines: https://julialang.github.io/Pkg.jl/dev/creating-packages/#Package-naming-guidelines-1



---
If you want to prevent this pull request from being auto-merged, simply leave a comment. If you want to post a comment without blocking auto-merging, you must include the text `[noblock]` in your comment.
<!-- [noblock] -->
<!---
this_is_the_single_automerge_comment
--->

I tried to use this package, e.g. `plot_bar()` but it doesn't work:

```jl
julia> plot_bar()
ERROR: MethodError: no method matching PlotlyBase.Plot(::Array{Any,1}, ::PlotlyBase.Layout{Dict{Symbol,Any}})
Closest candidates are:
  PlotlyBase.Plot(::TT, ::TL, ::TF, ::Base.UUID, ::PlotlyBase.Style) where {TT<:(AbstractArray{var"#s54",1} where var"#s54"<:PlotlyBase.AbstractTrace), TL<:PlotlyBase.AbstractLayout, TF<:(AbstractArray{var"#s55",1} where var"#s55"<:PlotlyBase.PlotlyFrame)} at /home/kc/.julia/packages/PlotlyBase/NxSlF/src/PlotlyBase.jl:35
  PlotlyBase.Plot(::AbstractArray{var"#s13",1} where var"#s13"<:PlotlyBase.AbstractTrace, ::Any) at /home/kc/.julia/packages/PlotlyBase/NxSlF/src/PlotlyBase.jl:60
  PlotlyBase.Plot(::AbstractArray{var"#s12",1} where var"#s12"<:PlotlyBase.AbstractTrace, ::Any, ::AbstractArray{var"#s81",1} where var"#s81"<:PlotlyBase.PlotlyFrame; style) at /home/kc/.julia/packages/PlotlyBase/NxSlF/src/PlotlyBase.jl:60
  ...
Stacktrace:
 [1] plot(::Array{Any,1}, ::Vararg{Any,N} where N; options::Dict{Any,Any}, kwargs::Base.Iterators.Pairs{Union{},Union{},Tuple{},NamedTuple{(),Tuple{}}}) at /home/kc/.julia/packages/PlotlyJS/m2Lzd/src/display.jl:145
 [2] plot(::Array{Any,1}, ::Vararg{Any,N} where N) at /home/kc/.julia/packages/PlotlyJS/m2Lzd/src/display.jl:145
 [3] plot_bar() at /home/kc/.julia/packages/HotPlot/JvD6w/src/plot_bar.jl:9
 [4] top-level scope at REPL[3]:1
```

How is it meant to be used?

plot_x_y

You can look at the notebook/example.ipynb for example. All things there should work.

I plan to add those missing functions gradually.
@fredrikekre , this one I hope to keep. plot_x_y and style works. Other functions are coming gradually.

This pull request has been inactive for 30 days and will be automatically closed 7 days from now.
